  "article_text": [
    "let @xmath6 be the open unit disc and let @xmath7 be a smooth compactly supported function .",
    "it defines a vector field @xmath8 which is tangent to the level sets of @xmath9 .",
    "let @xmath10 be the time - one map of the flow @xmath11 generated by @xmath12 .",
    "the diffeomorphism @xmath10 is area - preserving and every diffeomorphism arising in this way is called _",
    "autonomous_. such a diffeomorphism is relatively easy to understand in terms of its generating function .",
    "it is a well known fact that every smooth compactly supported and area - preserving diffeomorphism of the disc @xmath13 is a composition of finitely many autonomous diffeomorphisms @xcite .",
    "how many ? in the present paper we are interested in the geometry of this question .",
    "more precisely , we define the _ autonomous norm _ on the group @xmath14 of smooth compactly supported area - preserving diffeomorphisms of the disc by @xmath15 the associated metric is defined by @xmath16 .",
    "since the set of autonomous diffeomorphisms is invariant under conjugation the autonomous metric is bi - invariant .",
    "[ t : main ] for every natural number @xmath17 there exists an injective homomorphism @xmath18 which is bi - lipschitz with respect to the word metric on @xmath4 and the autonomous metric on @xmath19 .      1 .",
    "we show in the proof of theorem [ t : main ] that the embedding of @xmath4 is constructed to be in the kernel of the calabi homomorphism @xmath20 ( see remark [ rem : calabi ] for a definition and @xcite for more information ) .",
    "2 .   gambaudo and ghys defined in ( * ? ? ?",
    "* section 6.3 ) the autonomous metric on the group of area - preserving diffeomorphisms of the 2-sphere and showed that its diameter is infinite .",
    "3 .   for each @xmath21",
    "the group @xmath5 may be equipped with the right - invariant @xmath22-metric , see arnold - khesin for a detailed exposition @xcite .",
    "results similar to ours with respect to the @xmath22-metric were obtained by benaim - gambaudo in @xcite and by the first author in @xcite .",
    "4 .   in a greater generality ,",
    "the autonomous metric is defined on the group @xmath23 of compactly supported hamiltonian diffeomorphisms of a symplectic manifold .",
    "it is interesting to know if such a metric is always unbounded .",
    "even more generally the autonomous metric can be defined as follows .",
    "a compactly supported diffeomorphism @xmath10 of a manifold @xmath24 is called autonomous if it is the time - one map of a time - independent compactly supported flow @xmath11 .",
    "the group @xmath25 of all smooth compactly supported diffeomorphisms of the disc is generated by autonomous diffeomorphisms and hence the autonomous metric can be defined as above .",
    "however , it is known due to burago , ivanov and polterovich @xcite , that the autonomous metric is bounded in this case .",
    "since the autonomous metric is bi - invariant , investigating geometric properties of embeddings of non - abelian groups has to be done with respect to some bi - invariant metrics . at the time of writing this paper",
    "such metrics are not well understood . in section [ sec - relation ]",
    "we prove an algebraic result which may indicate some good geometric properties .",
    "more precisely , for a non - abelian free group of rank two we construct an injective homomorphism @xmath26 and prove that the image of the induced homomorphism @xmath27 on the spaces of homogeneous quasi - morphisms is infinite dimensional .",
    "let us start with a definition .",
    "a function @xmath28 from a group @xmath29 to the reals is called a _ quasi - morphism _ if there exists a real number @xmath30 such that @xmath31 for all @xmath32 .",
    "the infimum of such numbers @xmath33 is called the _ defect _ of @xmath34 and is denoted by @xmath35 .",
    "if @xmath36 for all @xmath37 and all @xmath38 then @xmath34 is called _ homogeneous_. any quasi - morphism @xmath34 can be homogenized by setting    @xmath39    the vector space of homogeneous quasi - morphisms on @xmath29 is denoted by @xmath40 . for more details about quasi - morphisms see e.g. @xcite .    the first part of the proof is to show that the space @xmath41 of homogeneous quasi - morphisms on @xmath19 which are trivial on the set of autonomous diffeomorphisms is infinite dimensional .",
    "this is done by constructing ( for @xmath42 ) an injective linear map @xmath43 where @xmath44 denotes the braid group on @xmath45-strings and @xmath46 is a certain abelian subgroup defined in section  [ sec - gg - construction ] .",
    "[ r : unbounded ] notice that the existence of a nontrivial homogeneous quasi - morphism @xmath47 that is trivial on @xmath48 implies that the autonomous norm is unbounded .",
    "indeed , for every @xmath49 we have that @xmath50 and hence for every natural number @xmath45 we get @xmath51 , provided @xmath52 .    the map @xmath53 is defined in section [ sec - gg - construction ] and is induced from the construction due to gambaudo and ghys @xcite .",
    "the fact that the quasi - morphism @xmath54 is trivial on the set of autonomous diffeomorphisms provided @xmath55 is trivial on @xmath56 is proved in section [ sec - proofs ] .",
    "the latter proof consists of two steps .",
    "first , we show that @xmath54 is trivial on autonomous diffeomorphisms generated by certain morse - type functions ( theorem [ thm : morse - type ] ) . secondly , the set of morse - type functions is dense in the set of all functions with respect to the @xmath57-topology , and @xmath58 is a continuous function , see theorem [ t : morse - ham ] .",
    "it is known that the space @xmath59 is infinite dimensional ( see section [ subsec - proof - t - q - aut ] ) and hence we obtain that @xmath41 is infinite dimensional .",
    "let @xmath60 be homogeneous quasi - morphisms comprising a set of @xmath2 linearly independent elements of @xmath61 .",
    "it follows that the map @xmath62 defined by @xmath63 is lipschitz and its image is quasi - isometric to the whole @xmath64 .",
    "the second part of the proof is a construction of a homomorphism @xmath65 with the required properties .",
    "it is in fact a section of the map @xmath66 mentioned above .",
    "it is defined by constructing @xmath2 diffeomorphisms @xmath67 with disjoint supports ( hence commuting ) such that @xmath68 , where @xmath69 is the kronecker delta .",
    "the above map @xmath70 is a quasi - morphism , if one defines an @xmath64 valued quasi - morphism analogously to the real valued one using an @xmath22-norm .",
    "observe that there exists a nontrivial homogeneous quasi - morphism @xmath71 on the free group of rank two with the image quasi - isometric to @xmath64 for every @xmath17 .",
    "this follows from the fact that @xmath72 is infinite dimensional .",
    "however , none of such quasi - morphisms admits a homomorphic section over @xmath4 for @xmath73 .",

    "the most famous metric on the group of hamiltonian diffeomorphisms of a symplectic manifold @xmath448 is the hofer metric , see @xcite .",
    "the associated norm is defined by @xmath449 where @xmath450 is a compactly supported hamiltonian function generating the hamiltonian flow @xmath203 from the identity to @xmath451 .",
    "the oscillation norm is defined by @xmath452 .",
    "let @xmath185 be a diffeomorphism generated by a time independent and non - negative hamiltonian function @xmath201 .",
    "it implies that all powers of @xmath222 are also autonomous and hence @xmath453 for all @xmath37 . on the other hand ,",
    "the calabi homomorphism is positive on @xmath222 and hence @xmath454 , for some positive constant .",
    "also , @xmath455 but @xmath456 .",
    "here @xmath457 is the unique diffeomorphism in the flow generated by @xmath201 such that its @xmath45-th power is equal to @xmath222 .",
    "this shows that the identity homomorphism between the autonomous metric and the hofer metric is not lipschitz in neither direction .",
    "let @xmath458 be the set of autonomous diffeomorphisms generated by hamiltonian functions with the @xmath459-norm bounded by @xmath460 .",
    "this set is invariant under conjugations and hence the corresponding word metric is bi - invariant .",
    "we call it the restricted autonomous metric and denote the corresponding norm by @xmath461 . for all @xmath262 these metrics",
    "are lipschitz equivalent .",
    "indeed , it is easy to check that if @xmath462 then @xmath463 for all @xmath464 .",
    "moreover , we have that @xmath465 for every  @xmath262 .",
    "this trivially implies that the main results of the paper hold for the restricted autonomous metric .",
    "let @xmath185 be such that @xmath466 with each @xmath467 is autonomous generated by a hamiltonian @xmath468 of the oscillation norm smaller than @xmath262 .",
    "@xmath469 we thus obtain the following estimate @xmath470 which proves that the restricted autonomous norm is not equivalent to the autonomous norm for there are autonomous diffeomorphisms with arbitrarily big calabi invariant .",
    "let @xmath471 be a set with nonempty interior .",
    "the fragmentation metric @xmath472 is a word metric defined with respect to the generating set consisting of diffeomorphisms conjugated to ones supported in @xmath381 .",
    "such a set is invariant under conjugations by construction and hence the fragmentation metric is bi - invariant .",
    "it follows from the proof of theorem [ t : main ] that there is a diffeomorphism @xmath222 supported in the set @xmath381 such that @xmath222 has arbitrarily big autonomous norm . clearly , the fragmentation norm of @xmath222 is equal to one .",
    "[ e : frag ] suppose that @xmath473 is a disc of radius @xmath474 . according to biran , entov and polterovich @xcite",
    ", the space of homogeneous calabi quasi - morphisms on @xmath475 is infinite dimensional .",
    "the calabi property means that the restriction of a quasi - morphism to the subgroup of diffeomorphisms supported on a displaceable subset is equal to the calabi homomorphism .    consider the subgroup @xmath476 .",
    "it is generated up to conjugation by diffeomorphisms supported in @xmath381 and hence the fragmentation metric is defined on @xmath328 .",
    "( in the next section we explain that this metric is equal to the autonomous metric induced from @xmath5 ) .",
    "let @xmath477 be a calabi quasi - morphism .",
    "since it is trivial on the generators it is lipschitz with respect to the fragmentation norm .",
    "it follows from the proof of theorem 2.3 in @xcite that there is an autonomous diffeomorphism @xmath478 and a homogeneous calabi quasi - morphism @xmath479 such that @xmath480 .",
    "this implies that @xmath481 can have arbitrarily big fragmentation norm .",
    "its autonomous norm is equal to one .",
    "this is a remark on the geometry of the inclusion @xmath482 with respect to the autonomous metric .",

    "both authors would like to thank the anonymous referee for careful reading of our paper and for his / her helpful comments and remarks .",
    "this work has been done during the first author stay in aberdeen and in mathematisches forschungsinstitut oberwolfach .",
    "the first author wishes to express his gratitude to both institutes .",
    "he was supported by esf grant number @xmath507 and by the oberwolfach leibniz fellowship .",
    "the visit in aberdeen was supported by the cast network .",

  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> let @xmath0 be the open unit disc in the euclidean plane and let @xmath1 be the group of smooth compactly supported area - preserving diffeomorphisms of @xmath0 . for every natural number @xmath2 we construct an injective homomorphism @xmath3 , which is bi - lipschitz with respect to the word metric on @xmath4 and the autonomous metric on @xmath5 . </S>",
    "<S> we also show that the space of homogeneous quasi - morphisms vanishing on all autonomous diffeomorphisms in the above group is infinite dimensional . </S>"
